page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT IN WOODLAND
page.content: The{major sources }of{employment}are farming,building,Glaxo Operations in Barnard Castle,Social Services, Schools,Forestry and Opencast Mining. Builders like to build houses on hard ground if possible and use{stone because it does not crumble and lasts longer especially in winter when we have severe frosts. Before builders put{slates}on they put on{plastic sheeting}so that if a slate falls off there is something underneath to stop it from leaking. After they have put the slates on they put{gutters}on the eaves. The gutters are made of{plastic,}the plastic is rounded.They put{drain pipes}on to stop the water falling on the windows. There is some{unemployment}especially among the male population.{50 to 100 {years ago}the majority of males were employed in the drift coal mines.
